parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-MGA-GLO-EPH
Expected IDs: class_id=0x13, message_id=0x06

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-MGA-GLO-EPH". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. Set the "message_type" JSON field based on the "Type" row in the message header table:
   - "Type: Input" → message_type: "input"
   - "Type: Output" → message_type: "output"  
   - "Type: Periodic" → message_type: "periodic"
   - "Type: Polled" → message_type: "polled"
   - "Type: Command" → message_type: "command"
   - "Type: Set" → message_type: "set"
   - "Type: Get" → message_type: "get"
   - Combinations like "Periodic/Polled" → message_type: "periodic_polled"
3. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
4. Verify field sizes match offset differences (e.g., if offset jumps by 4, field is 4 bytes).

FIELD EXTRACTION:
- byte_offset: Exact byte offset from "Offset" column (integer, 0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX types: U1, I1, X1, U2, I2, X2, U4, I4, X4, R4, R8, CH
- For arrays: {"array_of": "U1", "count": N} - check Type column for "[N]" or "x N"
- scale: Include "raw" string and numeric "multiplier" if shown
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- fixed_value: For "type" fields at offset 0 (especially MGA messages), if the description
  says "Message type (0x01 for this type)", set fixed_value to the integer (e.g., 1).
  This value identifies the specific message variant.

PAYLOAD LENGTH:
- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12"}}

QUALITY CHECK before returning:
- Byte offsets sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps
- Total field sizes match payload length


Return the extracted message using the ubx_message_extraction tool.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Message type (0x01 for this type)

fields.name: version
fields.description: Message version (0x00 for this version)

fields.name: svId
fields.description: GLONASS Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering)

fields.name: reserved1
fields.description: Reserved

fields.name: FT
fields.description: User range accuracy

fields.name: B
fields.description: Health flag from string 2

fields.name: M
fields.description: Type of GLONASS satellite (1 indicates GLONASS-M)

fields.name: H
fields.description: Carrier frequency number of navigation RF signal, Range=(-7.. 6), -128 for unknown

fields.name: X
fields.description: X component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: Y
fields.description: Y component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: Z
fields.description: Z component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: dx
fields.description: X component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: dy
fields.description: Y component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: dz
fields.description: Z component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddx
fields.description: X component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddy
fields.description: Y component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: ddz
fields.description: Z component of the SV acceleration in PZ-90.02 coordinate System

fields.name: tb
fields.description: Index of a time interval within current day according to UTC(SU)

fields.name: gamma
fields.description: Relative carrier frequency deviation

fields.name: E
fields.description: Ephemeris data age indicator

fields.name: deltaTau
fields.description: Time difference between L2 and L1 band

fields.name: tau
fields.description: SV clock bias

fields.name: reserved2
fields.description: Reserved
